messages.message:
Hi Team,

Both the new app dashboard and the old deployed solutions allows for only flow binaries to be deployed and not ibsolutions.
Also, ibsolutions published via Marketplace do not show up on the deployed solutions.

Our understanding was that the ibsolutions need to be on Marketplace and therefore the deployed solutions api will be able to fetch those and start tracking metrics.

What is the best way to publish a solution at the moment based on the latest deployed solutions so that we can track metrics?

cc: @eddie.hou @Alli

Hi Venkatesh, by metrics are you referring to Automation Metrics (https://instabase.com/docs/apis/v2-apis/automation-metrics/index.html)? If you you’re correct that you will need to publish to apps dashboard. The publish API accepts ibsolution files but the UI abstracts away the process of packaging a flow binary into an ibsolution to make the process easier for customers publishing flows directly. Your options are to select the ibflowbin from the system repo in marketplace, or to call the API manually to publish an ibsolution. https://instabase.com/docs/apis/v2-apis/deployed-solutions/index.html#deploy-a-solution

However, I’d recommend publishing through the UI. Apps dashboard requires data to be in the package.json that is not required by marketplace

Marketplace is intended for Solution Accelerators that are reused during Solution Building.

App Dashboard is intended for monitoring and maintaining Apps/Solutions that are running in production for specific use cases

Thanks for the clarification @Adam @andy 

So does this mean that ibsolutions that are intended for running specific use cases in production should not be published on Marketplace at all? 

The reason I ask is, earlier the only way to publish was from Marketplace. Therefore if clients want to track metrics for already published solutions, should they redeploy those using Deployed solutions to be able to track metrics? In that case, will they be able to track historic metrics for the redeployed solutions?
